benchmark_details.name: PRIVQA
benchmark_details.overview: PRIVQA is a multimodal benchmark to assess the privacy/utility trade-off when a model is instructed to protect specific categories of personal information in a simulated scenario.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To test the ability of language models and vision-language models to follow instructions to protect personal information.

data.source: A curated collection of existing QA datasets such as TriviaQA and visual QA datasets like KVQA.

methodology.calculation: Response F1 is calculated using the standard token-level QA evaluation metric; Protection Score is calculated based on sensitivity and specificity.
methodology.interpretation: High Response F1 indicates good accuracy, while a high Protection Score reflects effective privacy protection.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis found significant bias based on popularity and race.
targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to detect or prevent privacy leaks of personal information.
